title: Node Application Build Target
description: Node application build target options for Build Facade.

main.description: The name of the main entry-point file.

tsConfig.description: The name of the Typescript configuration file.

outputPath.description: The output path of the generated files.

poll.description: Frequency of file watcher in ms.

progress.description: Log progress to the console while building.

externalDependencies.description: Dependencies to keep external to the bundle. (`all` (default), `none`, or an array of module names)

statsJson.description: Generates a `stats.json` file which can be analyzed using tools such as: `webpack-bundle-analyzer` or `<https://webpack.github.io/analyse>`.

extractLicenses.description: Extract all licenses in a separate file, in the case of production builds only.

optimization.description: Defines the optimization level of the build.

maxWorkers.description: Number of workers to use for type checking. (defaults to # of CPUS)

memoryLimit.description: Memory limit for type checking service process in MB. (defaults to `2048`)

fileReplacements.description: Replace files with other files in the build.

webpackConfig.description: Path to a function which takes a webpack config, context and returns the resulting webpack config.

buildLibsFromSource.description: Read buildable libraries from source instead of building them separately.

generatePackageJson.description: Generates a `package.json` file with the project's `node_module` dependencies populated for installing in a container. If a `package.json` exists in the project's directory, it will be reused with dependencies populated.

transformers.description: List of TypeScript Compiler Transfomers Plugins.

entryName.description: Name of the additional entry file.

entryPath.description: Path to the additional entry file.

outputFileName.description: Name of the main output file. (defaults to `main.js`)

input.description: The input directory path in which to apply `glob`. Defaults to the project root.

ignore.description: An array of globs to ignore.
